dialogue.text: Affection........decay..........ten points..........everyone........leaving.........
Not everyone! I’m still here! You’re okay!
They didn’t hurt you, did they? {b}Let me see your hands.{/b} I want to make sure you didn’t get any glass stuck in them.
I know! I’m sorry! I shouldn’t have left you! I thought they’d be at the party! I didn’t expect them to come here! Not today!
You’re right. It isn’t safe here anymore...
If those two are going to try stealing you away from me, it means others might try something as well.
Ayane’s already here every day. And Niki and Noriko keep trying to get inside too. Which means it’s only a matter of time before Chika and Makoto and everyone else comes breaking in next.
It’s you and me against the world. {i}Again.{/i} But we’ve fought this fight before. We just need to hang on a little bit longer and we’ll have the life we’ve always wanted.
Doesn’t that sound great?! It’ll be like the last two months, just it’ll go on forever and ever and ever and ever and ever-
I’m afraid I don’t know what you’re talking about, [amimaster]. And I imagine that, right now, you’re so shaken up from the house being broken into that {i}you{/i} don’t know either.
So why don’t you just lay back down while I clean up the glass and figure out how to replace a window?
She’s gone.......because of-
Stop blaming yourself for everything!
You always do that, but you’ve never done a {i}thing{/i} wrong in your life! You’re a good person! It’s everyone else who’s evil, not you!
And if anyone {i}did{/i} leave, it’s probably because they realized they never deserved you in the first place! Or that they never loved you at all!
All those girls! All those messages and dirty pictures! They were all trying to take advantage of you! Every single one of them! But they failed!
They failed because you still chose me in the end! Like you’re supposed to! Because you know that I’m the only one for you! The only one who will ever get it!
I know...
I tell myself I’m the perfect niece, but I know better than anyone how perfection’s just a lie now that Mom is gone.
I’m trying really hard to be just like her...but it seems impossible, [amimaster]. How could one half ever replace a whole?
What?...
You {i}saw{/i} her?
Where?...How?...
In a dream?...Because, if that’s the case, I see her too. Every night when I close my eyes.
Well, maybe not {i}every{/i} night because I always {i}always{/i} dream of you too. But when it’s not you, which it always is, it’s her.
Sometimes, it’s the three of us. Sometimes my dad is there too.
But...you know what, Sensei? You’re just as much of a dad to me as he was. Maybe even more so.
You’ve been with me longer, after all. Not by much, but by enough. And you’ve seen me grow into a special girl who-
Shut up!
You’ve seen me grow into a special girl who would do anything to make you happy. {i}Anything.{/i} So if there’s anyone you want me to get rid of, all you have to do is tell me. [amimaster].
It’s either that, or we leave everyone behind and go somewhere no one can find us.
Somewhere {i}outside{/i} the barrier.
I’m sure it’ll be scary, but-
No...
Why “no?” Don’t tell me you {i}want{/i} all those evil girls chasing after you all day? Because we both know that would be a lie.
And right now, anything you {i}think{/i} you want is a thought you’re only thinking ‘cause you’re cornered.
Close your eyes. Close your eyes and think back to the moment you were happiest.
What is it you see, [amimaster]?
{b}Don’t talk. You’ll just ruin everything.{/b}
You see {i}me,{/i} don’t you?
You’ve seen so many things, yet it’s {i}me{/i} who’s at the forefront of your happiest memory.
You probably see the two of us...cuddled together on the couch...your body pressing up against mine...
You can feel my warmth...smell my shampoo...and I can hear your heartbeat.
Thump thump...thump thump...like it’s the soundtrack to a brighter day. And all my troubles melt a-
Don’t cry! Don’t cry! I’m right here! I’ve got you...
Is it...
Is it really over?...
Is {i}what{/i} over? The...home intrusion? Yeah. Yeah, I sent them away before they could hurt you. You’re safe now.
No...that’s not...
Is...
{b}Maya...{/b}
Is she...
{i}Stop{/i} bringing her up.
Maya never cared about you. And she never {i}will{/i} care about you because she’s a filthy liar who manipulates people into doing what she wants them to do. Plus, she-
I told you to shut up!
Plus, she’s changed a lot these last couple months. I guess her true colors are really coming out now that her favorite {i}toy{/i} has been taken away.
I will be a toy if it means...
You will do nothing of the sort. Your brain is going haywire right now and you’re saying things you don’t mean. But that’s {i}my{/i} fault for leaving you alone in a place where people can find you.
I should have worked harder to keep the bugs out.
But I’ll learn from this mistake.
I’ll learn from this mistake and take you somewhere no one will be able to find you...so you can rest and recover in peace and remember just who it is you {i}really{/i} are.
But until then...until you’re {i}you{/i} again...you’re just going to have to trust me.
Only {i}I{/i} can fix you. Not Ayane. Not {i}Maya.{/i} And sure as hell not Uta and Io, who are probably blabbing to the rest of the girls as we speak.

It was only a matter of time until the lot of them started forcing their way in, just like they forced themselves into your contacts and your life. Into {i}our{/i} life. A life I’ve wanted back for {i}years.{/i}
I won’t give it up again, [amimaster]. The sting of loneliness is a bit too much for a frail little girl like me to bear.
And you don’t want to see me {i}break,{/i} do you?
You want to keep me {i}happy,{/i} don’t you?
Exactly.
I didn’t...say anything...
You don’t need to.
I understand you better than {i}you{/i} ever will.
Now close your eyes and drink your milk while I read you another Christmas story.
When the morning comes, you’ll feel much better. Every day you grow some more.
A perfect season, perfect weather-
On the way to twenty-four.
Miles away, we’re reunited with a very peculiar family as they carefully inspect a building purchased by the eldest child.
While she initially claimed the reason for this was to better prepare her for the future ahead, the truth is that it was a concerted effort to make an adult male like her more.
The thing is, this truth wasn’t even known by her at the time the property was purchased — and it wouldn’t become relevant until days later on a hidden beach inhabited by glowing insects.
There, bathed in neon light, she would take inadvertent notice of the beating of her heart — thump thump, thump thump — as she subconsciously thanked God that she showed up when she did.
It was a selfish thought. And she hated having selfish feelings, so she shelved it the best she could and pretended to be apologetic about the interruption.
But she was lying.
She didn’t have much experience with lying, but she didn’t {i}need{/i} it as she had acquired the skill at birth.
You see, her mother was exceptional at it. So exceptional that her daughters still believed her to be pure of heart despite the organ pumping sludge through her veins on a near constant basis.
It was this sludge that was passed on to her daughters. And while it had not fully corrupted them yet, it was sure to do so over time.
Some might say it had already gotten to the youngest of the three — but those who {i}would{/i} say that have neglected her feelings just as much as her family has.
Another truth is that the young one was disposable. There was no need for a second child in the Tsukioka family. Their existence was naught more than a failsafe should the eldest perish.
Tsukasa Tsukioka knew this. And some nights, she prayed that a terrible fate would befall her older sister because she knew it would make her more loved without needing to act out.
But she was also kind at heart, so these thoughts made her cry. And she would keep them to herself,  subconsciously unearthing them only during fits of anger or jealousy.
The three made an interesting trio. A solar system, if you will — with two small planets orbiting a sun that, if it wanted to, could destroy everything in its path.
But tonight was a night for creation. Or at least the {i}support{/i} of creation as one of the planets in the solar system was in the process of building its very own moon.
Or perhaps it was a space station. Maybe even a satellite of sorts. Regardless, it was being put there not for aesthetic or tidal purposes, but for safety.
It could be a meatless meat shield for unlucky asteroids — or shelter should humanity’s decline inch ever closer to zero.
But whatever it was, it was dangerous since the kindness of one heart often incites nearby ones to latch on like cardiovascular lampreys.
These creatures would not know they were sucking sludge out of arterial straws.
And the world would turn black as the spread of this substance would no longer be avoidable.
But I suppose that’s all conjecture.
I suppose that’s just one of many potential outcomes.
After all, predicting the future means nothing when the past and the present so often rewrite themselves.
But it {i}does{/i} keep things interesting.
And that was all the sun wanted at the end of the day.
Hmm...
Unless even {i}I’ve{/i} been lied to.
Touka dear, you’ve contacted a contractor about the walls, correct? I’ve noticed cracks in several of them and I’m beginning to question just what was used to construct this building.
Yes, Mother. I have several quotes for repairs on file and three more inspections scheduled for tomorrow morning.
Excellent. And Chika? Have you spoken with her recently?
Not as recently as {i}you,{/i} I presume. I’ve been a bit preoccupied with {i}this.{/i}
Yes, well, {i}she’s{/i} been a bit preoccupied with the apparent disappearance of your teacher. Which I assume is a contributing factor to your recent {i}attitude{/i} as well, my dear.
Mother, the television keeps breaking! I can’t get any channel to stay on!
I wonder if it’s because it’s so small?
Don’t worry, darling. I’m sure your sister has someone coming to look at {i}that{/i} tomorrow as well.

I do not have an {i}attitude,{/i} Mother. I am simply overwhelmed with the amount of work I’ve had to do as of late. And I would greatly appreciate it if you would not take {i}your{/i} attitude out on {i}me.{/i}
I’m doing no such thing. I just don’t understand why you haven’t asked me to step in at all if the absence of your beloved teacher is causing you so much distress.

Aren’t we only meant to use our {i}influence{/i} when it means bettering something? Because, regardless of my personal feelings on the matter, Sensei’s absence does little measurable {i}harm{/i} to anyone.

Yes, but don’t you think things have been awfully {i}boring{/i} these last two months? Even {i}I{/i} had more fun when he was around. Why, I’ve checked his room twice tonight in hopes of encountering him.
Please stay out of my tenant’s rooms, Mother. It’s an invasion of their privacy and goes against several important terms in the rental agreement.
Mother! The television’s back on!
This show looks kind of weird, though.
That’s very nice, Tsukasa. And Touka, need I remind you that you only have {i}one{/i} tenant at the moment? And I doubt Ak...{i}ahem...{/i}Arakawa-sensei would mind me going through his things.
It’s {i}about{/i} to be two. And Sensei doesn’t {i}have{/i} anything for you to go through, Mother. He barely even uses this place.
Oh my, it sounds as if you’ve done a fair bit of exploring in his room as well. Haven’t you, dear?
Only when necessary.

So you concede that we can get our hands dirty when it’s {i}necessary,{/i} do you? In that case, how much longer do you think we should wait before doing a little...{i}interference{/i} in his affairs?
For the greater good, of course. That greater good being {i}us.{/i}
Don’t you mean {i}me?{/i} He’s my teacher, after all. And unless you don’t trust me, you have little reason to even communicate with him.
Well, that’s not true at all. He’s become quite a good friend of mine. And soon, he’ll be tutoring your little sister. Isn’t that right, Tsukasa?
Yes, Mother. And, is it okay if I stand next to you now? This show is really weird.
Of course, dear. And you don’t need permission to stand next to me.
Could you not find her a different tutor? It’s one thing to delay her studies for two months, but to do so because you’re waiting for {i}my{/i} teacher to become available is just...well, it’s odd.
Nonsense, dear. Tsukasa’s taken quite the liking to Arakawa-sensei. Haven’t you, Tsukasa?
That’s right, Mother. He {i}is{/i} my future husband after all. I will most likely {i}have{/i} to like him at some point.
Hahah! My, how adorable!
Is there anything else the two of you need? Or can I go back to finalizing the listings for my apartment now?
I advised Chika the room would be ready for her come the new year. And I’m beginning to worry it might take at least another three months to get you two {i}out{/i} of it.
My, you’re awfully catty tonight, aren’t you? Who’d have known that my darling daughter’s first rebellious phase would be due to {i}love?{/i}
Out! Now!
Hahah! Come, Tsukasa. Let’s get you to bed.
But...Mother! Touka just raised her voice at you! We’re never supposed to do that!
Your big sister is going through a {i}very{/i} stressful time in her life right now, dear. It’s probably best if we keep our noses out of it until she’s feeling a little better.
But that could take forever! What if she stays miserable for the rest of her life like all of my servants?
I’m sure she’ll go right back to normal once her teacher’s {i}vacation{/i} comes to an end.
I said get out!
